sen.j: 息長真手王（おきながのまてのおおきみ、生没年不詳）は5世紀から6世紀頃の日本の皇族。
sen.e: Prince Okinaga no Mate [Okinaga no Mate no Okim (息長真手王); his date of birth and death were unknown]' was a Japanese Imperial family during the fifth century to sixth century.
Prince Okinaga no Mate (Okinaga no Mate no Okimi; his date of birth and death were unknown) was a Japanese Imperial family during the fifth to sixth century.
sen.cmt: ()と[]の変更および１つめのcenturyの削除しました。
sen.e: Prince Okinaga no Mate (Okinaga no Mate no Okimi; his date of birth and death were unknown) was a Japanese Imperial family during the fifth to sixth century.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 王女に麻績郎女・広姫。
sen.e: His princesses were Ominoiratsume (麻績郎女) and Hirohime (広姫).
His princesses were Ominoiratsume (麻績郎女) and Hirohime (広姫).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His princesses were Ominoiratsume (麻績郎女) and Hirohime (広姫).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 麻績郎女は継体天皇の妃として荳角皇女を産んだ。
sen.e: Ominoiratsume married the Emperor Keitai as a princess and bore a princess, Imperial Princess Sasage ["Sasage no Hime Miko (荳角皇女)"].
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Ominoiratsume married the Emperor Keitai as a princess and bore a princess, Imperial Princess Sasage Sasage no Hime Miko.
sen.cmt: ()と[]の変更しました。
sen.e: Ominoiratsume married the Emperor Keitai as a princess and bore a princess, Imperial Princess Sasage Sasage no Hime Miko.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 広姫は敏達天皇の皇后として押坂彦人大兄皇子・逆登皇女・菟道磯津貝皇女を産んだ。
sen.e: Hirohime became the Empress of the Emperor Bidatsu and bore 'Prince Oshisaka no Hikohito no Oe [(押坂彦人大兄皇子), 'Oshisaka no Hikohito no Oenomiko'], Princess Sakanobori [(逆登皇女) 'Sakanobori no Hime Miko'], and Princess Uji no Shitsukai [(菟道磯津貝皇女) "Uji no Shitsukai no Hime Miko"; also know as "Uji no Kaitako no Hime Miko" (菟道貝蛸皇女)].
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Hirohime became the Empress of the Emperor Bidatsu and bore Prince Oshisaka no Hikohito no Oe (Oshisaka no Hikohito no Oenomiko), Princess Sakanobori (Sakanobori no Hime Miko), and Princess Uji no Shitsukai.
sen.cmt: know→known,ほかダブルクオート、()と[]の変更しました。
sen.e: Hirohime became the Empress of the Emperor Bidatsu and bore Prince Oshisaka no Hikohito no Oe (Oshisaka no Hikohito no Oenomiko), Princess Sakanobori (Sakanobori no Hime Miko), and Princess Uji no Shitsukai.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 王女2人が天皇の妃となった以外、さしたる事蹟の記述はない。
sen.e: Prince Okinaga no Mate did not have many achievements, other than marriage of his two princesses to the Emperors.
Prince Okinaga no Mate did not have many achievements, other than marriage of his two princesses to the Emperors.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Prince Okinaga no Mate did not have many achievements, other than marriage of his two princesses to the Emperors.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 意富富杼王の弟にあたる息長沙禰王の子であるとの文献もある。
sen.e: Additionally, there were others documents which indicated Prince Okinaga no Mate to be the son of 'Okinaga no Sane no Miko' (息長沙禰王) who was a brother of Prince Ohodo (意富富杼王).
Additionally, there were others documents which indicated Prince Okinaga no Mate to be the son of Okinaga no Sane no Miko who was a younger brother of Prince Ohodo.
sen.cmt: youngerの追加、シングルクオートの削除しました。
sen.e: Additionally, there were others documents which indicated Prince Okinaga no Mate to be the son of Okinaga no Sane no Miko who was a younger brother of Prince Ohodo.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 広姫は敏達天皇5年（575年）正月に立后したものの、同年11月に崩御した。
sen.e: Although Hirohime became the Empress of the Emperor Bidatsu on the New Year Day of year '575', she met with her demise during November of the same year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Although Hirohime (Prince Hiro) became the Empress of the Emperor Bidatsu on the New Year Day in 575, she met with her demise during November of the same year.
sen.cmt: (Prince Hiro)を追加しシングルクオートの削除などしました。
sen.e: Although Hirohime (Prince Hiro) became the Empress of the Emperor Bidatsu on the New Year Day in 575, she met with her demise during November of the same year.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その翌年の正月には額田部皇女（後の推古天皇）が皇后に立てられた。
sen.e: In the very next year, on the New Year Day, Nukatabe no Himemiko (the Imperial Princess Nukatabe) became the Empress of the Emperor Bidatsu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In the very next year, on the New Year Day, Nukatabe no Himemiko (the Imperial Princess Nukatabe, later Empress Suiko) became the Empress of the Emperor Bidatsu.
sen.cmt: later Empress Suikoの部分を追加しました。
sen.e: In the very next year, on the New Year Day, Nukatabe no Himemiko (the Imperial Princess Nukatabe, later Empress Suiko) became the Empress of the Emperor Bidatsu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 広姫の御陵は近江国坂田郡（滋賀県米原市）にある。
sen.e: Her goryo (an Imperial mausoleum) of Hirohime exists in Sakata-gun, Omi Province (Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Her goryo (an Imperial mausoleum) of Hirohime exists in Sakata-gun, Omi Province (Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Her goryo (an Imperial mausoleum) of Hirohime exists in Sakata-gun, Omi Province (Maibara City, Shiga Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: それは、息長御陵と称されて、宮内庁の管理下にある。
sen.e: Her goryo came to known as the "Okinaga Goryo" and is currently managed by The Imperial Household Agency.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Her goryo came to known as the "Okinaga Goryo" and is currently managed by The Imperial Household Agency.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Her goryo came to known as the "Okinaga Goryo" and is currently managed by The Imperial Household Agency.

sen.j: 娘の一人が「継体天皇」に嫁ぎ、もう一人の娘が「敏達天皇」の皇后・広姫であるという。
sen.e: One of the daughters of Prince Okinaga no Mate married "the Emperor Keitai" and the other daughter married "the Emperor Bidatsu."
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: One of the daughters of Prince Okinaga no Mate married 'the Emperor Keitai,' and the other daughter married 'the Emperor Bidatsu' is assumed to be Hirohime.
sen.cmt: ダブルクオート→シングルクオートに変更、広姫の訳漏れを補足しました。
sen.e: One of the daughters of Prince Okinaga no Mate married 'the Emperor Keitai,' and the other daughter married 'the Emperor Bidatsu' is assumed to be Hirohime.

sen.j: が、記紀などによって「継体」の生年は西暦450年、一方「敏達」の生年は西暦538年である。
sen.e: However, according to the "A Record of Ancient Matter" and "Chronicles of Japan," "Keitai" was born in '450'; and on the other hand, "Bidatsu" was born in '538.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, according to the "A Record of Ancient Matter" and "Chronicles of Japan," 'Keitai' was born in 450 and on the other hand, 'Bidatsu' was born in 538.
sen.cmt: ダブルクオート→シングルクオートに変更しました。
sen.e: However, according to the "A Record of Ancient Matter" and "Chronicles of Japan," 'Keitai' was born in 450 and on the other hand, 'Bidatsu' was born in 538.

sen.j: 娘が二人の大王に輿入れしたとは到底考えられない。
sen.e: In conclusion, it is hard to believe that two of his daughters married two of the Emperors.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In conclusion, it is hard to believe that two of his daughters married two of the Emperors.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In conclusion, it is hard to believe that two of his daughters married two of the Emperors.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 伝承が混乱しているのか、或いは記紀の編集者が意図的に系図に手を加えた可能性が強い。
sen.e: Maybe the oral literature from this historical period is confused; or it is very possible the editors of the "A Record of Ancient Matter" and "Chronicles of Japan" intentionally forged the contents of the genealogical charts of the Emperors.

Maybe the oral literature from this historical period was confused; or it is very possible that the editors of the "A Record of Ancient Matter" and "Chronicles of Japan" intentionally forged the contents of the genealogical charts of the Emperors.
sen.cmt: is→was、および thatの追加しました。
sen.e: Maybe the oral literature from this historical period was confused; or it is very possible that the editors of the "A Record of Ancient Matter" and "Chronicles of Japan" intentionally forged the contents of the genealogical charts of the Emperors.
